column2: name
Cold, Heated Water & Recycled Water
column8: ITP 001 Hydraulics – Cold, Heated Water & Recycled Water

column2: Scope of work
Check documents are current & for construction
Check levels & falls
Competency
Trade Registration
Set Out
Mark out pipe and fixture locations and co-ordinate with other trades. Ensure that correct fixture information is being used
Existing services have been located and marked out as appropriate (eg/dial before you dig drawings) and the Services Subcontractors own services scan carried out
Pipes Support
Pipes to be supported as per AS 3500. Extra supports to be added to prevent pipe movement caused by water pressure effects
Valves
Check valves for water mark approval.
Piping
Pipework sizes as per for construction drawings.
Pipework is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification
Pipe/conduit locations and alignment is in accordance with design requirements
Minimum separation of underground services is achieved
Cast Ins / Penetrations / Blockouts installed to IFC detail and signed off on pre pour ITP
Pipe/conduit penetrations in accordance with approved services location.
Penetrations are of suitable height and have been capped where required.
Pipework penetration collars/isolation is in accordance with specified requirements
Pipework have been installed without damage
Pipework Joints have been appropriately treated/glued
Pipe/conduit compliance record/certificate
Thrust blocks installed as per detail
Protruding services have been adequately protected from future construction damage
Insulation
Specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
Marking & Labelling
Underground pipework to have identification tape installed.
All marking tape is in accordance with Australian Standards
Pits
Specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings (AS 3500)
Testing

Prior to testing the system shall be flushed of all foreign matter. Hydrostatic pressure test before backfilling, lagging & covering. Pipework with elastomeric or RRJ shall be backfilled leaving the joints exposed. Test as per AS 3500.4. 1500 KPA for 30 min. No leaks are acceptable. Some fixtures cannot handle 1500 KPA.These items are to be disconnected for the 1500 KPA test then reconnected and tested at their maximum operation pressure for 30 min
Backfill Compaction

Backfill pipe with sand and fill balance of trench with selected excavated spoil. Photographs of installed services prior to backfill. Bedding material is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification. Bedding material grading certificate to be provided. Trench backfill material is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification.
Final Trim / Clean Site
Final clean and grade site area affected by the water services scope of works. Excess spoil removed in accordance with terms of contract
All Authority approvals have been received with Supporting records from Services Subcontractors
Final Inspection / Completion
Verify all inspections, complete records. All Authority approvals have been received with Supporting records from Services Subcontractors
Record Drawings
Provide Requirement as per contract documentation including Dimensioned, Surveyed, Falls, Locations, Components

Installation aligning with IFC documentation - Any deviation from the IFC documentation must first be developed and coordinated in BIM / Revit model. Subcontractor to organise clash detection review and identify any issues to the wider team, wider team to review and sign off on any changes. As-built documentation to be prepared and submitted by Services Subcontractors within 28 days of works being installed.

Hydrants
Scope of work
Check documents are current & for construction
Competency
Trade Registration
Set Out & Service Location
Mark out hydrant locations as per contract documents and compliance with AS2419.1 Fire Hydrant Installations.
Services in trenching area have been located or shown on documentations prior to commencing works.
Trenching
Where excavations are >1.5m deep Services Subcontractors have prepared a Safe Work Method Statement and submitted to HY and permit completed
A Plant Safety Verification has been conducted for all mobile plant to be used for In Ground Services Installation
Pipes Support

Pipes to be supported as per AS2419 clause 8.7. Vertical & Horizontal support as per AS2491.1 Fire Hydrant Installations. Table 8.7.7. DN80 Max spacing 5m, DN100 Max spacing 5m & >100 Max spacing 6m. underground pipework to be secured as per AS2419.1 clause 8.8
Valves
Valve to comply with AS2638.1 Gate valves for waterworks purposes ,AS2638.2 Resilient seated gate valve & AS3579 Cast Iron Wedge gate valve for general purpose.
Piping
Pipework selection and sizes as per specifications and for construction drawings.
Pipework is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification
AS2419 Fire Hydrant Installations
Marking & Labelling
Underground pipework to have identification tape installed.
All marking tape is in accordance with the Australian standard
Testing
Prior to test the system shall have all air and debris flushed from the system as per AS 2419.1 clause 10.2.1

Hydrostatic pressure test to AS2419.1 clause 8.4. Pressure tests at 1500 KPA or 1.5 times the design pressure whichever is the greater for duration of 2 hours. If pipe work is underground the test shall be made before covering of the joints takes place. The pipework sections will be partially backfilled for securing during test.
Backfill Compaction
Photographs of installed services prior to backfill.
Backfill pipe with sand and fill balance of trench with selected excavated spoil
Bedding material and trench backfill is in accordance with IFC Drawings, sample submission and specification
(Bedding material grading certificate to be provided)
Final Trim / Clean Site
Final clean and grade site area affected by the water services scope of works. Excess spoil removed in accordance with contract terms
Excess spoil removed in accordance with contract terms
Final Inspection / Commission
System shall be commissioned as per AS2419.1 Fire Hydrant Installations clause 10.3. Details of commission attached to back of ITP.
Record Drawings
Provide Requirement as per contract documentation including Dimensioned, Surveyed, Falls, Locations, Components. Provide verifications of testing
Hydraulic Pumps
Scope of work
Check documents are current & for construction
Competency
Trade registration for installation. Australian certified manufacturer for pump manufacture and commission.
Set Out
Review current for construction drawing for pump locations.
Existing services have been located and marked out as appropriate (eg/dial before you dig drawings) and the Services Subcontractors own services scan carried out
Pump Selection
Specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
Testing & Commissioning
Prior to testing the system shall be flushed of all foreign matter.
Pumps shall be commissioned as per the manufacturer's recommendation.
Pump Operation – test for correct rotation
Automatic Changeover – Test changeover sequence under all operational combinations
Level Controls – Operate pumps, measure levels and adjust if necessary.
Safety Controls – Simulate fault for each safety control
Alarms – Simulate alarm condition. Verify correct alarm raised.
Motor: Measure motor current and adjust overloads to suit.
Completion test – Provide a full operational test to verify compliance.
All Authority approvals have been received with Supporting records from Services Subcontractor.
Services Consultant(s) field inspection report(s) - Subcontractor to address all items raised by consultants and other project stakeholder
Record Drawings
Provide Requirement as per contract documentation including Dimensioned, Surveyed, Falls, Locations, Components

Installation aligning with IFC documentation - Any deviation from the IFC documentation must first be developed and coordinated in BIM / Revit model. Subcontractor to organise clash detection review and identify any issues to the wider team, wider team to review and sign off on any changes. As-built documentation to be prepared and submitted by Services Subcontractors within 28 days of works being installed

Pipe Support
Pipes to be supported as per AS 3500.2 Table 9.1
Pipe Laying
Pipes to be laid in straight lines between changes of directions. Pipes are to be laid on base of crushed hard rock or coarse washed sand.
Pipework selection and sizes as per specifications and for construction drawings and AS 3500
Pipework is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification
Pipe has been laid to correct RL/IL's & cover over pipes is correct depth
Pipe/conduit locations and alignment is in accordance with design requirements

Pits
Pits to have smooth, seamless finish using steel trowel or concrete cast in steel frames. Design and for construction drawings
Testing
Test to AS 3500.3 Section 10 Clauses 10.3 .1 & 10.3.2 Hydrostatic Water Test for a period of 3min.
Hydrostatic tests have been successfully conducted. Supporting Records to be provided
Protruding services have been adequately protected from future construction damage
Inground services have been inspected by the relevant authorities/consultants prior to closing up (witness/hold point)
Pipe/conduit compliance record/certificate
Backfill Compaction
Pipes are to be laid on base of crushed hard rock or coarse washed sand. The balance of the trench to be filled and compacted with selected removed spoil.
Bedding material is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification
Bedding material grading certificate to be provided
Trench backfill material is in accordance with the IFC drawings, sample submission and specification
Photographs of installed services prior to backfill
Surfaces disturbed during services installation have been adequately reinstated/repaired
Final Trim / Clean Site
Final clean and grade site area affected by the Stormwater scope of works
Excess spoil removed from site by as per contract terms
Final Inspection / Completion
Verify all inspections, complete records clean and flush entire installation
All Authority approvals have been received with Supporting records from Services Subcontractors

Commissioning of Plant and Equipment
column8: ITP 015 Hydraulics - Commissioning of Plant and Equipment

column2: Scope of Work
Check documents are current & for construction
Location of all plant and equipment will be in accordance with for construction drawings and documentation
Plant and equipment will be in accordance with the Hydraulic Services Specifications
Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009
Competency
Trade registration for installation. Australian certified manufacturer for pump manufacture and commission.
Set Out
Plant and equipment locations will be determined using dimensions on construction drawings and will be coordinated with all other associated trades
Manufacturer's details for all plant, equipment, water meters etc will be referenced during all set out procedures
Existing services have been located and marked out as appropriate (eg/dial before you dig drawings) and the Services Subcontractors own services scan carried out
Pipe Supports
Pipework will be supported in accordance with AS 3500 and the Hydraulic Services Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009
Valves
Valves will meet the requirements of the Hydraulic Services Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009
A detailed valve schedule will be provided for easy identification and purpose
Piping
Pipe selection and Pipework sizes as per AS 3500 and Hydraulic Services Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009, sample submission and IFC Drawings.
Pipe has been laid to correct RL/IL's & cover over pipes is correct depth
Pipe/conduit locations and alignment is in accordance with design requirements
Pipe/conduit penetrations in accordance with approved services location.
Penetrations are of suitable height and have been capped where required.
Pipework penetration collars/isolation is in accordance with specified requirements
Pipework have been installed without damage
Pipework Joints have been appropriately treated/glued
Pipe/conduit compliance record/certificate
Thrust blocks installed as per detail
Protruding services have been adequately protected from future construction damage
Marking & Labelling
In accordance with AS 3500.1 and Hydraulic Services Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009
All marking tape is in accordance with Australian standard.
Valve & Pump Pits or Boex
In accordance with AS 3500.1 and Hydraulic Services Specification reference S09168 Revision o4, Approved for Construction, 11.12.2009
Testing
All Authority approvals have been received with Supporting records from Services Subcontractors
A register of all testing equipment and calibration certificates will be provided prior to any testing and commissioning procedures commencing
Clean Site
Final clean of the site area affected by the scope of works
Trade waste and excess materials are to be removed from the site area
Final Inspection / Completion
Verify all inspections and complete records
Services Consultant(s) field inspection report(s) - Subcontractor to address all items raised by consultants and other project stakeholder

Provide Requirement as per contract documentation including Dimensioned, Surveyed, Falls, Locations and Components. Provide verifications of testing
